articles.description: But there are still limits to the types of food that can withstand microgravity. Anything that can produce crumbs, for instance, is considered dangerous, since food particles can clog a spacecraft’s electrical systems or air filters.
articles.content: Space food is notoriously lackluster, but new technology is slowly revolutionising the way astronauts eat. Whereas the first astronauts in space squeezed their meals from toothpaste-like tubes, today… [+3085 chars]

articles.title: 4 New Elements Added to Periodic Table - IndustryWeek
